history.content:
If you have 2 semesters left, you don't really have that much time to pick professors.

But classes worth taking from hardest to easiest:

189, 164, 162, 161, 186

Ideally I would go:

FA: 162, 161, 186

SP: 189, 164 

This makes 2 challenging but manageable semesters.

Classes that are probably not worth taking if you're crunched for time:

188 (redundant with 189), 169 (basically a graded internship), 160 (unless you specifically do UI/UX),  184 (maybe useful if you want to specifically do graphics but o/w no)

children.subject:
Came across this while trying to decide what to do for my last two semesters as well!

I do think it's really important to consider how much time you'll be spending recruiting in the fall vs. what you want to learn. It's something I'm struggling with too because there are plenty of things I want to take still!  But for the sake of your sanity while recruiting I'm not sure if that fall semester is the best suggestion; I'd just leave out 161 entirely. 

My two cents on it: I took 161 and 162 together while recruiting (the ol' 3-5 interviews a week) and it definitely made last semester the worst so far in Berkeley (granted, I am also heavily involved in multiple ECs); 161 is a "broad but shallow" coverage of security topics which makes parts of exams somewhat similar to trivia quizzes (our final had a good deal of fill-in-the-blank), while 162 is more of a deep dive. You'll pretty much always have a project, design doc, or homework due for 162, and while 161 is on/off workload-wise the projects are kind of "bang-your-head-against-it" style if you're new to security concepts. TLDR 161 is really interesting and was a fun course, but I'd say 162 is much more worth it (and I personally loved the course!). 

-- also the draft schedule only has 164 for the fall which is a big sad ): trying to figure out if I should bite the bullet and take it during recruiting season

history.content: I'm currently an EECS junior and was wondering which upper div CS courses I should take for my last two semesters. So far I have completed all my lower div requirements and have taken CS 170/188 and DS 100. Would you recommend taking 6 upper divs in 2 semesters? I want to take 189, 160, 186, 169, 184, and maybe 162. How should I split them to balance the workload? Which upper divs would you recommend for going into industry? Are there any other upper divs/ professors you would recommend? Any advice is appreciated!
history.subject: Senior Year Courseload
